datastrucandalgorithms.linkedlist
Class PolyNode

java.lang.Object
  datastrucandalgorithms.linkedlist.PolyNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class PolyNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

A node for storing Polynomial terms

Author:
Brian Jerardi
Instructor:
Kendall Martin
Date:
10/02/2011
Course:
CIS 112
Assignment:
HW2 Chapter 4 problem 13 page 239
Note:
Lists of nodes can be made of any length, limited only by the amount of free memory in the heap. But beyond Integer.MAX_VALUE (2,147,483,647), the answer from listLength is incorrect because of arithmetic overflow.

Constructor Detail

PolyNode

public PolyNode(int intialExponent,
                double intialCoefficient,
                PolyNode intialLink)
Initialize a node with a specified initial exponent, coefficient and link to the next node. Note that the initialLink may be the null reference, which indicates that the new node has nothing after it.

Parameters:
intialExponent - the initial exponent of this new node
intialCoefficient - the initial coefficient of this new node
intialLink - a reference to the node after this new node--this reference may be null to indicate that there is no node after this new node.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - intialExponent is negative
Precondition:
intialExponent is not negative
Postcondition:
This node contains the specified data and link to the next node.
Method Detail

addNodeAfter

public void addNodeAfter(int ex,
                         double coe)
Modification method to add a new node after this node.

Parameters:
ex - the exponent to place in the new node
coe - the coefficient to place in the new node
Throws:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Indicates that there is insufficient memory for a new IntNode.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ex is negative
Precondition:
ex is not negative
Postcondition:
A new node has been created and placed after this node. The data for the new node is ex and coe. Any other nodes that used to be after this node are now after the new node.

removeNodeAfter

public void removeNodeAfter()
Modification method to remove the node after this node.

Parameters:
- - none
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Indicates that this was the tail node of the list, so there is nothing after it to remove.
Precondition:
This node must not be the tail node of the list.
Postcondition:
The node after this node has been removed from the linked list. If there were further nodes after that one, they are still present on the list.

listCopy

public static PolyNode listCopy(PolyNode source)
Copy a list.

Parameters:
source - the head of a linked list that will be copied (which may be an empty list in where source is null)
Returns:
The method has made a copy of the linked list starting at source. The return value is the head reference for the copy.
Throws:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Indicates that there is insufficient memory for the new list.

listLength

public static int listLength(PolyNode head)
Compute the number of nodes in a linked list.

Parameters:
head - the head reference for a linked list (which may be an empty list with a null head)
Returns:
the number of nodes in the list with the given head
Note:
A wrong answer occurs for lists longer than Int.MAX_VALUE.

listPosition

public static PolyNode listPosition(PolyNode head,
                                    int position)
Find a node at a specified position in a linked list.

Parameters:
head - the head reference for a linked list (which may be an empty list in which case the head is null)
position - a node number
Returns:
The return value is a reference to the node at the specified position in the list. (The head node is position 1, the next node is position 2, and so on.) If there is no such position (because the list is too short), then the null reference is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that position is not positive.
Precondition:
position > 0.

listSearch

public static PolyNode listSearch(PolyNode head,
                                  int target)
Search for a term with exponent target in a linked list.

Parameters:
head - the head reference for a linked list (which may be an empty list in which case the head is null)
target - the exponent to search for
Returns:
The return value is a reference to the first node that contains the specified target. If there is no such node, the null reference is returned.

the coefficient from this node

newCoefficient - the new coefficient to place in this node
Postcondition:
The coefficient of this node has been set to newCoefficient.
